item.title: About Me
item.author: axiompraxis
item.description:
Intro

Hi, I'm axiompraxis aka Andy (he/him), an introverted, Canadian former telecoms analyst turned DevOps person/software developer. I live in British Columbia with my boyfriend, dog, and cat.

I get vertigo sometimes, infrequently, for which I have to wear two types of glasses (no, bifocals won't work) prescriped by a neuro-opthalmologist. It's not debilitating 95% of the time.

Tech I really like

  • kubernetes (studying for CKAD)
  • Python
  • Go (studying)
  • debian
  • markdown
  • CI/CD processes in general
    • ArgoCD
    • Github Actions and Tekton
  • playwright & k6
  • opentofu, the open source fork of Terraform (haven't used it professionally yet, but experimented with it a lot)

Tech I've Used, not exhaustive

  • Genesys PureEngage (Expert with GIR & SpeechMiner)
  • Operating Systems
    • Linux/Unix
      • Ubuntu (and Debian as mentioned above)
      • CentOS
      • RHEL
      • Gentoo
      • Arch
      • lots of others, including BSDs
    • Windows Server (and desktop too)
    • Mac OS
  • Clouds
    • AWS
    • Azure
    • GCP
  • Containers & Orchestrators
    • Kubernetes
      • EKS
      • AKS
      • GKE
      • ARO (Azure Redhat Openshift)
      • Microk8s
      • k3s
    • Docker, podman, buildah
    • containerd, cri-o, runc
  • Ansible
  • Service meshes
    • Hashicorp Consul
    • Istio
    • Cilium
  • JavaScript/TypeScript
    • NodeJS
  • Virtualization
    • VMware (vSphere/ESXi)
    • qemu
    • proxmox
    • Oracle Virtualbox
    • vagrant
    • libvirt
  • DBs
    • Oracle
    • Postgres
    • SQL Server
  • Load Balancers & Web Servers
    • HAProxy
    • Nginx
    • Apache httpd
    • Apache tomcat
    • Microsoft IIS
    • Jetty
  • Redis
  • Kafka
  • Jenkins
  • ElasticSearch/OpenSearch

Personal

Things I like to do

  • Learning about new and interesting technology
  • I read (like, a lot a lot) sci-fi and fantasy, mostly progression fantasy lately (Cradle by Will Wight is amazing, seriously check it out)
  • Swimming
  • I play video games
    • currently
      • Final Fantasy XIV (prefer healing & SAM/RDM)
    • sporadically
      • Cyberpunk 2077
      • Ghostrunner 1 & 2
      • Octopath Traveler 1 & 2
      • Heroes of the Storm
    • formerly
      • Destiny 2 (Titan main)
  • Walks with dog and boyfriend
  • Music
    • Synthwave
    • EDM

item.title: More Job Hunting.. and chicken
item.author: axiompraxis
item.description:
Trying to stay motivated and keep a "9am - 5pm wake up and do stuff" schedule, updating some skills via Udemy, applying to different places that look interesting.

Some friends are doing CV/resume review so hopefully that helps too.

Went out with some friends yesterday for Korean Fried Chicken (crispy and yangnyeom)!

item.title: Trying out Zola
item.author: axiompraxis
item.description:
So, yeah, zola (what this blog is written in) is pretty cool. It's a static site generator written in rust that takes a little getting used to, but is incredibly powerful once you get it.

It also lets you write in markdown.

I'm trying to learn Azure, study for my CKAD, and job hunting after a layoff. Ideally I'd like to do something with CI/CD pipelines, automating build processes, and generally leaving everything in a better state than when I found it.

This site is generated by Github Actions as part of a CI/CD process!
